paper_title.en: FINITE-ELEMENT NEURAL-NETWORK FOR NONINVASIVE PLANT WATER STATUS MONITORING

description.en: The finite element neural network (FENN)was applied to a non-invasive technique to monitor the plant water status of greenhouse-grown chrysanthemums. The governing differential equation (Poisson's equation) was utilized for neural information processing. The solution of the Poisson's equation was obtained using the finite element technique. A Kalman filter was used as a learning algorithm of the FENN. It was demonstrated as a practical example of the FENN applications that the FENN provided a means of estimating the leaf water potentials (correlated outputs of the FENN) of a greenhouse-grown chrysanthemum from the digital image data of its leaf (correlated inputs of the FENN) .
